importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Limp Bizkit was formed in 1994, marking the beginning of their influential role in shaping the nu metal genre and bringing heavy music into the mainstream.
Sam Rivers received the Gibson Award for Best Bassist in 2000, highlighting his recognition and excellence in bass playing as a key professional achievement.
Sam Rivers left Limp Bizkit in 2015 due to liver disease from excessive drinking, signaling a pivotal moment in the band’s history and reflecting personal health struggles.
The date of the article's publication marks the announcement of Sam Rivers' death at age 48, a significant moment in music and public memory.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period from 1994 to 2000 is the formative and peak era of Limp Bizkit’s rise to fame, during which they defined the nu metal movement and influenced mainstream music culture.

keyTakeAways: Sam Rivers, the founding bassist of Limp Bizkit, has died at the age of 48, prompting the band to mourn his loss as a central creative force.
Rivers was not only a musical talent—winning the Gibson Award for Best Bassist in 2000—but also a deeply influential figure in the band's identity and sound.
The band described him as 'the soul in the sound,' emphasizing his irreplaceable emotional and artistic presence in their music.
Rivers left the band in 2015 due to liver disease from excessive drinking, underwent treatment, and received a successful liver transplant, demonstrating his resilience and health journey.
Limp Bizkit's music, including hits like 'Rollin’ (Air Raid Vehicle)' and 'Take a Look Around,' helped define the late 90s nu metal scene and brought heavy music to a broader audience.
The band has continued to release new music and perform, such as a new single in September and a Reading Festival performance in August, showing ongoing activity despite Rivers' absence.
Rivers’ charitable work and friendships were highlighted in the tribute, showing his impact beyond music into social and community spheres.
The cause of death remains undisclosed, and the band has asked fans to respect the privacy of Rivers’ family.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Sam Rivers, the founding bassist and a central creative force in the US nu metal band Limp Bizkit, has died at the age of 48. The band, formed in 1994, described Rivers as 'the soul in the sound' due to his irreplaceable musical and emotional presence. His influence is evident in their signature hip-hop rock style and expletive-laden lyrics, with hits like 'Rollin’ (Air Raid Vehicle)' and 'Take a Look Around' helping define the late 90s music landscape. Rivers left the band in 2015 due to liver disease from excessive drinking, underwent treatment, and received a successful liver transplant. He was awarded the Gibson Award for Best Bassist in 2000 and was recognized for his charitable work. The band continues to release new music, such as the single 'Making Love to Morgan Wallen,' and perform at major events like the Reading Festival. While the cause of death is not disclosed, the band has honored Rivers' legacy through music, charity, and personal tributes, emphasizing his lasting impact on both the band and the music world.
title: Limp Bizkit bassist Sam Rivers dies aged 48
